author: kolbyml
content: I am just getting into Ethereum myself, but I would recommend a lot of reading. In the stage 1 doc, Piper goes over looking at old forum posts etc in finding potential projects. He also links a few places to start which from that I have already found some stuff I am interested in working on. Well I am not that experienced in terms of Eth yet, if something interests you I would recommend just diving in whether that is reading code or forum/blog posts.

author: kolbyml
content: <https://github.com/ethereum-cdap/cohort-zero/blob/main/stage-1-project-discovery.md> You can read the post Piper made here which I guess answers your question.

author: jacobkaufmann
content: Is there any way to determine existing support/priority/importance of draft EIPs/proposals aside from views/activity? This exists in some form in the core paper and the stage 1 notes, but what other methods/resources can we use to separate stronger project candidates from weaker ones?
